article.headline: Jacksonville 74, Mercer 68
article.story: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. -- Delwan Graham scored 16 points and Ayron Hardy added 15 to lead Jacksonville over Mercer 74-68 on Sunday night. The Dolphins (19-8, 12-5 Atlantic Sun Conference) shot 55.2 percent from the floor (16 of 29) in the opening half en route to a 37-30 halftime advantage. Jacksonville stretched its lead to as many as 11, 56-45, with 12:19 left to play after reeling off 10 straight points in a 2:08 span. The Bears (13-16, 10-8) answered with an 8-0 run that cut their deficit to 56-53 with less than 10 minutes remaining. Jake Gollon tied the score at 68 with 2:44 to go as both teams went scoreless over the next 2-plus minutes. Graham broke the drought on a jumper with 26 seconds to play, giving the Dolphins a 70-68 lead. Langston Hall scored 22 points and Chris Smith added 10 for Mercer, which had its five-game winning streak snapped.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
